revised_title: Mineral Dusts in the Environment: Health Risks and Identification Methods
tldr: This article discusses the presence and range of mineral dusts in the environment, focusing on their impact on human health. It highlights the various sources of mineral dusts, such as mining, quarrying, and industrial activities, and their potential health risks, including lung diseases and cancer. The article also presents methods for identifying and analyzing mineral dusts in environmental samples, emphasizing the importance of electron microscopy and X-ray diffraction techniques.
